newsitem.title: CHINA: China Q1/97 trade surplus $6.71 billion --Xinhua.
newsitem.headline: China Q1/97 trade surplus $6.71 billion --Xinhua.

text.p: China posted a trade surplus of $6.71 billion in the first quarter of 1997, the Xinhua news agency said on Monday, quoting customs statistics.
Note: Figures in billions of U.S. dollars.
Exports in the first quarter were up 25.7 percent compared with the same 1996 period, Xinhua said.
Imports between January and March slipped by 1.8 percent compared with the year-ago period, it said.

Exports of general products jumped a year-on-year 35.7 percent to $15.41 billion in the first quarter, the agency said. The figure accounted for 43.4 percent of total exports, up from 41.6 percent in the same 1996 period.
Imports of machinery and electronic products fell sharply, it said without elaborating.
